result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Kenneth J. Shoemaker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: Distribution to Minors], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Intent. Contribute/Delinquency Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.40(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Oneida County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Refrain from conduct which constitutes a violation of the criminal laws of any state of the United States or ordinances substantially conforming to a criminal statute.
If defendant is arrested or named as a defendant in a criminal complaint in any jurisdiction defendant shall notify Oneida County DA's office in writing within 10 days.
Defendant to notify Oneida County DA's office in writing of any change of address and/or telephone number.
Bail continued.
Defendant will not be revoked from probation in Counts 2 and 3 in 15cf253.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth J. Shoemaker

records.addlTxt:
3:57 p.m. Defendant Kenneth J. Shoemaker in court with attorney William Allen Dickens.  Defendant Kenneth J. Shoemaker in custody.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 17cf241, 15cf253, 15fo854, 16tr1616, 15tr2131, 16tr1614, 16tr1615, 16tr1068, 16tr1617, 14fo15, 14cm319. 
In 17cf241 - State moves to amend Information to add Count 2 - simple possession of THC, a misdemeanor, 961.41(3g)(e) - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest pleas to both Counts 1 and 2.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty of Count 2. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists for Count 1, accepts plea, defers entry and accepts written agreement. Pfeifer/Dickens/Court statement on sentencing.
15cf253- All parties in receipt of revocation packet. Pfeifer/Dickens/Court statement on sentencing.

Court Sentence
17cf241-Count 2
WHS/POP - 1 year
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.

15cf253
Count 3 
Jail - 7 months 
Jail credit - 160 days

Count 2
Jail  - 6 months CC to Count 3
Any unpaid financial obligations are reduced to civil judgment

Bail in 17cf241 - Court modifies to $7,500 signature bond. 

Review hearings - New review hearing scheduled for Monday, September 10, 2018 at 3:00 p.m. Same review hearing scheduled for 17cf241 costs. Payment plan reinstated - $50 monthly payment amount.

Appeal rights given. 
Adj. 4:21 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for January 27, 2020 at 03:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 2, 2018 at 03:30 pm.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant appeared in person in custody - court questions further - court will authorize $25.00 a day credit for time served.  Court questions if can pay a $100 a month to get back on payment plan -defendant statement to that.  Court will not put on payment plan at this time and sets over, but strongly suggests to defendant is he is able to get back to work to make sure he makes payments before next review date.
for modification of conditions of probation
3:45 p.m. Defendant Kenneth J. Shoemaker not in court.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to dismiss Count 1- Granted. Adj. 3:46 p.m.

11:28 a.m. Defendant Kenneth J. Shoemaker in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Defendant Kenneth J. Shoemaker in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek states agreement. State moves to amend Count 1 to violation of 948.09 - A misdemeanor and amend Count 2 to violation of 961.41(3g)(e) - Possession - A Misdemeanor - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Deferred Entry of Judgment Agreement filed. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty on Counts 2 and 3. Count 1 Court finds that a factual basis for plea exists and accepts deferred agreement. Schiek/Hogan/Court statement on sentencing. Schiek states complied with victim rights legislation.
Court Sentence
Counts 2 and 3
WHS/POP - 2 yrs
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Otain HSED or GED- Obtain/Maintain full time employment/student
AODA assessment and recovery
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO

Bail continued on Count 1. 
Appeal rights given
Adj. 11:53 a.m. 
  Review hearing scheduled for December 19, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

2:55 p.m. Defendant Kenneth J. Shoemaker in court, via video, with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Defendant Kenneth J. Shoemaker in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek files Information - Hogan in receipt of Information - waiver further reading - enters not guilty pleas to Counts 1 -3 - negotiations are on-going -close to resolution. Bail continued. Adj. 2:57 p.m.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 30, 2015 at 11:30 am.

11:46 a.m. Defendant Kenneth J. Shoemaker in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Defendant Kenneth J. Shoemaker in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Bail continued. Adj. 11:49 a.m.  Arraignment scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter
No telephonic contact of any kind with any person under the age of 18.  No unsupervised contact with any females under the age of 18 - parent of female must be immediately present.

2:47 p.m. Defendant Kenneth J. Shoemaker in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan, both via video.  Defendant Kenneth J. Shoemaker in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing. Bednar/Hogan statement to bond. Bond modified to include No telephonic contact of any kind with any person under the age of 18- No unsupervised contact with any females under age of 18 - parent of female must be immediately present.
Bail continued  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 25, 2015 at 11:45 am.
No contact with victim, IMB and ZC.  No intoxicants; no taverns

1:20 pm Defendant Kenneth J. Shoemaker in court, via video, in custody.  Michael Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel -  Schiek statement to bail -Defendant states legal name is Kenneth Schoemaker - Court sets $ sig bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
